snippet: The United States National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Monday fined Triumph Motorcycles up to $2.9 million for violating safety reporting requirements.
abstract: United States National Highway Traffic Safety Administration fines British company Triumph Motorcycles $1.4 million for violating safety reporting requirements in connection with 2014 recall; company must also spend at least $500,000 on safety improvements and could be fined additional $1 million if more violations are found.
lead_paragraph: The United States National Highway Traffic Safety Administration on Monday fined Triumph Motorcycles up to $2.9 million for violating safety reporting requirements.

headline.main: U.S. Fines Triumph for Failing to Report Defect
headline.print_headline: U.S. Fines Triumph for Failing to Report Defect
